text: Steven Collins (16 September 1951 – 15 February 2018) was a British-born Buddhist studies scholar. He earned a master's degree and doctorate from the University of Oxford and lectured at the University of Bristol before joining the University of Chicago faculty in 1991, where he was named the Chester D. Tripp Professor in the Humanities. Collins died in New Zealand, where he was attending a seminar, on 15 February 2018, at the age of 66. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:Academics of the University of Bristol Category:University of Chicago faculty Category:British Buddhist scholars Category:University of Chicago Divinity School faculty
title: Steven Collins (Buddhist studies scholar)
